title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0039

segments.en: And we're bringing you another great elementary lesson for all those elementary learners.
segments.cn: 我们为所有初学者带来另一节精彩的初级课程。

segments.en: In today's lesson, we've got some excellent language that will help you to describe someone's appearance.
segments.cn: 在今天的课程中，我们有一些优秀的语言，帮助你描述某人的外貌。

segments.en: It's something that everyone has learned before in school, describing people.
segments.cn: 这是每个人在学校都学过的，描述人。

segments.en: So we're going to review that and give you some better phrases.
segments.cn: 所以我们将复习一下，并给你一些更好的短语。

segments.en: So, let's listen to our dialogue for the first time, and then we'll come back and talk about it.
segments.cn: 那么，让我们第一次听听对话，然后再回来讨论。

segments.en: I heard you were on a date last night.
I want all the juicy details.
Um, well... Actually, we had a fantastic time last night.
segments.cn: 嗯，实际上，我们昨晚过得很愉快。

segments.en: Okay, now you really have to fill me in.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在你真的得告诉我。

segments.en: He's in his early 30s, and he's got the most beautiful dark brown eyes.
segments.cn: 他三十出头，拥有最美丽的深棕色眼睛。

segments.en: What does he do for a living?
David is a junior investment banker at Fortune Bank, so he's got a great career path ahead of him.
segments.cn: David是Fortune Bank的初级投资银行家，所以他有很好的职业发展前景。

segments.en: I don't know how I would feel about dating my friend's brother.
segments.cn: 我不知道我会对和朋友的哥哥约会有什么感觉。

segments.en: No, I wouldn't feel good about it.
Well, because if you break up with the brother, then that means you'll have to end the friendship with your best friend.
segments.cn: 嗯，因为如果你和哥哥分手，那就意味着你必须结束和你最好的朋友的友谊。

segments.en: Girls are more complicated with that.
Let's look at the language before this gets too far.
segments.cn: 在这变得太复杂之前，让我们看看语言。

segments.en: Alright, let's take a look at language takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看语言要点。

segments.en: Language takeaway On language takeaway today, we're bringing you three words.
segments.cn: 今天的语言要点，我们带来三个单词。

segments.en: So you guys know this word.
But the way it's used is quite interesting.
Let's listen to a couple of examples of how it's used.
I heard you're dating a new guy.
segments.cn: 我听说你在和一个新男孩约会。

segments.en: Julie told me she heard that you're pregnant.
segments.cn: Julie告诉我她听说你怀孕了。

segments.en: So when you say, for example, oh, I heard you were pregnant.
segments.cn: 所以当你说，比如说，哦，我听说你怀孕了。

segments.en: Whoa, this is like telling someone that you found some information about them, but you're not sure if it's true or if it's false.
segments.cn: 哇，这就像告诉某人你得到了关于他们的信息，但你不确定这是真的还是假的。

segments.en: Okay, our next word, fill me in.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们下一个单词，fill me in。

segments.en: So when you tell someone to fill you in.
segments.cn: 所以当你告诉某人填补我。

segments.en: You're saying tell me about it.
I could say, I'm sorry I was late for the meeting.
segments.cn: 我可以说，我很抱歉我迟到了会议。

segments.en: Can you fill me in on what happened?
segments.cn: 你能告诉我发生了什么吗？

segments.en: Or I could say, I missed the first five minutes of the movie.
segments.cn: 或者我可以说，我错过了电影的前五分钟。

segments.en: And our last phrase today, career path.
segments.cn: 我们今天最后一个短语，career path。

segments.en: I guess this is the plan for your job over several like 10 or 20 years.
segments.cn: 我想这是你在10或20年内的工作计划。

segments.en: All the different jobs and things you do during your career.
segments.cn: 在你的职业生涯中你所做的所有不同的工作和事情。

segments.en: So in this case, David has a really good career path because he's going to be a really rich and powerful investment banker.
segments.cn: 所以在这种情况下，David有一个很好的职业道路，因为他将成为一个非常富有和有权势的投资银行家。

segments.en: So now let's listen to our dialogue again and pay special attention to the language used to describe David.
segments.cn: 现在让我们再听一次对话，特别注意描述David的语言。

segments.en: Because when we come back, we're going to talk about this.
segments.cn: 因为当我们回来时，我们将讨论这个。

segments.en: Irene, I heard you were on a date last night, so how did it go?
segments.cn: Irene，我听说你昨晚约会了，那么怎么样？

segments.en: I want all the juicy details.
Um, well, actually, we had a fantastic time last night.
segments.cn: 嗯，实际上，我们昨晚过得很愉快。

segments.en: Okay, now you really have to fill me in.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在你真的得告诉我。

segments.en: He's in his early 30s and he's got the most beautiful dark brown eyes.
segments.cn: 他三十出头，拥有最美丽的深棕色眼睛。

segments.en: What does he do for a living?
David is a junior investment banker at Fortune Bank.
segments.cn: 大卫是财富银行的初级投资银行家。

segments.en: So he's got a great career path ahead of him.
segments.cn: 所以他有很好的职业前景。

segments.en: So we found some really great words and phrases used to describe someone.
segments.cn: 所以我们找到了描述某人的一些很好的词汇和短语。

segments.en: There's a lot of language in here talking about the way someone looks.
segments.cn: 这里有很多关于某人外貌的语言。

segments.en: So let's listen again as Irene describes David.
segments.cn: 所以让我们再听一遍艾琳描述大卫。

segments.en: He's in his early 30s and he's got the most beautiful dark brown eyes.
segments.cn: 他三十出头，拥有最美丽的深棕色眼睛。

segments.en: He's in his early 30s and he's got the most beautiful dark brown eyes.
segments.cn: 他三十出头，拥有最美丽的深棕色眼睛。

segments.en: Okay, so let's break this down.
The first thing she says is he's really good looking.
segments.cn: 她说的第一件事是他真的很好看。

segments.en: So good looking is the equivalent of handsome.
But I think good looking sounds a lot more natural than handsome.
segments.cn: 但我觉得好听听起来比英俊自然得多。

segments.en: Yeah, you wouldn't really use handsome.
segments.cn: 是的，你不会真的用英俊。

segments.en: Even though it's correct, it's just good looking sounds much more natural.
segments.cn: 虽然这是正确的，但好看听起来更自然。

segments.en: I guess for me, whenever someone says handsome, it sounds like an older person saying that.
segments.cn: 我想对我来说，每当有人说英俊时，听起来就像是一个年长的人在说。

segments.en: Like my grandma would say, oh, he's a handsome young man.
segments.cn: 就像我奶奶会说，哦，他是个英俊的年轻人。

segments.en: Okay, now let's look at the next thing she said.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在让我们看看她说的下一个。

segments.en: So we know quite means very.
segments.cn: 所以我们知道很高意味着非常。

segments.en: So you can describe a person in different ways.
segments.cn: 所以你可以用不同的方式描述一个人。

segments.en: So these are great words we can use to describe someone's height.
segments.cn: 所以这些是我们可以用来描述某人身高的好词汇。

segments.en: Then she talked about his exact height.
segments.cn: 然后她谈到了他的确切身高。

segments.en: This is interesting because in the United States and Canada, you give a person's height using feet and inches.
segments.cn: 这很有趣，因为在美国和加拿大，你用英尺和英寸来表示一个人的身高。

segments.en: So we don't talk about meters and centimeters.
segments.cn: 所以我们不谈米和厘米。
所以6英尺1寸就是6英尺1寸。

segments.en: But in other countries you would talk about centimeters or meters.
segments.cn: 但在其他国家你会谈论厘米或米。

segments.en: So this is an interesting difference between...
segments.cn: 所以这是一个有趣的区别...

segments.en: English speaking countries and European countries.
segments.cn: 英语国家和欧洲国家之间。

segments.en: Okay, so the next time you give your height to someone, make sure you do it in feet more or less.
segments.cn: 好吧，下次你告诉别人你的身高时，确保你用英尺来表示。

segments.en: It sounds a lot more natural.
And actually if you say to somebody in Canada, for example, I'm 175 centimeters.
segments.cn: 实际上，如果你对加拿大的某人说，我是175厘米。

segments.en: They wouldn't know really how tall that was.
segments.cn: 他们真的不知道那有多高。

segments.en: Now, the next part is really, really useful.
segments.cn: 现在，下一部分真的非常有用。

segments.en: She said he's in his early 30s.
So this is a way of describing someone's age without actually giving the exact number.
segments.cn: 所以这是描述某人年龄的一种方式，而不实际给出确切的数字。

segments.en: And you could do the same thing for... Like 40s.
segments.cn: 你也可以对... 像四十多岁这样说。
四十多岁、五十多岁、六十多岁。

segments.en: You wouldn't do that... You wouldn't do this before your 20s.
segments.cn: 你不会在二十岁之前这样做...

segments.en: I don't think it's really common to talk about your teens.
segments.cn: 我觉得谈论青少年并不常见。

segments.en: You wouldn't say like his mid-teens or early teens.
segments.cn: 你不会说他的中学或早期青少年。

segments.en: Okay, great language used to describe people.
segments.cn: 好吧，描述人的语言很好。

segments.en: So this is another sort of informal way of describing someone who's really good-looking.
segments.cn: 所以这是另一种非正式的方式来形容一个非常好看的人。

segments.en: It could be girl or boy.
Maybe even a little bit offensive.
You wouldn't go up to a girl and say, wow, you're hot.
segments.cn: 你不会走到一个女孩面前说，哇，你很帅。

segments.en: No, it's a little bit too impolite.
You would say, wow, you're really pretty or you're gorgeous.
segments.cn: 你会说，哇，你真的很漂亮或者你很迷人。

segments.en: No, you would never say that to somebody.
segments.cn: 不，你绝对不会对某人这样说。

segments.en: That's something you would comment with your friends.
segments.cn: 这是你和朋友们评论的事情。

segments.en: Okay, so we've looked at some really good language for describing people.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们已经看了一些描述人的非常好的语言。

segments.en: Now we could listen to our dialogue a third time and I'm sure you will understand everything.
segments.cn: 现在我们可以第三次听我们的对话，我相信你会理解一切。

segments.en: I heard you were on a date last night.
I want all the juicy details.
Um, well... Actually, we had a fantastic time last night.
segments.cn: 嗯，实际上，我们昨晚玩得很开心。

segments.en: Okay, now you really have to fill me in.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在你真的得告诉我。

segments.en: He's in his early 30s and he's got the most beautiful dark brown eyes.
segments.cn: 他三十出头，拥有最美丽的深棕色眼睛。

segments.en: What does he do for a living?
David is a junior investment banker at Fortune Bank.
segments.cn: 大卫是财富银行的初级投资银行家。

segments.en: So he's got a great career path ahead of him.
segments.cn: 所以他有很好的职业前景。

segments.en: Okay, so we looked at really useful language for describing people.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们看了一些描述人的非常有用的语言。

segments.en: And we want you to describe your girlfriend, boyfriend... Or even yourself.
segments.cn: 我们希望你描述你的女朋友、男朋友... 或者甚至你自己。

segments.en: And try and use the language from today's lesson.
segments.cn: 尝试使用今天课程中的语言。

segments.en: Right, so come to EnglishPod.com and leave your questions and comments on our website.
segments.cn: 对，所以来EnglishPod.com，在我们的网站上留下你的问题和评论。

segments.en: And we'll definitely be there to answer any doubts as well.
segments.cn: 我们一定会在这里回答任何疑问。

segments.en: Well guys, thanks for listening today.
segments.cn: 好吧，大家，感谢你们今天的收听。
